trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Westminster
There was one other sighting in Westminster on or around June 4th 2009
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Very bright pulsating object in southern sky, below cloud level of 1200 feet _ [cms/tg/pid]
divs: sighting detailsi looked out the bedroom window at 4:21am thursday june 4, 2009 and saw it was cloudy outside. i was very disappointed as i wanted to go out early before sunrise and get some photographs. i looked in the location where i sometimes see an object that should not be there and noticed an object wass there but higher up in the clouds. i determined a cloudy picture of a ufo is better than no pictures at all so i got ready for work. by the time i got downstairs, setup the camera and tripod and got outside i found the object was very bright and not in the clouds at all. either the clouds had risen or this object had dropped in elevation. i came to the conclusion that it had dropped in elevation when i compared the first sighting at 4:21am when it was much higher in the sky. i took a total of 30 pictures using different settings and the first picture was taken at 4:48am and the last picture taken at 4:56am. the first setting was night landscape, then night portrait and finally i used auto which turned out the best for the photographs and this object. the object was pulsating with an even pattern to it. the timing of the pulsation was about 1 second between high and low. i got photographs of the object at its lowest level of pulsation and then at its brightest level of pulsation. while pulsating the object would grow faint and then get very bright. in comparing the brightness level it would be much brighter than any planet or star in the night sky should the night sky have been visible. this bright star like object is just slightly east of south, mostly south. i have taken pictures of objects in this same location four other times in the early morning hours before sunrise. i pulled a weather report and conditions that were current as of 3am on the morning of june 4, 2009 and it shows the following: temperature: 50.7 degrees humidity: 95% dew point: 49 degrees wind: 0.0 mph wind gust: 0.0 mph pressure: 24.66 rising visibility: 5.0 miles uv: 0 out of 16 clouds: overcast 1200 feet above ground level, scattered clouds 400 feet elevation: 5462 feet this object was well below the cloud level but i cannot say for certain how far below the clouds it was. if i had to estimate the elevation of this object i would say between 800-1000���������. some of the pictures taken of this object show a pattern that almost appears to be square shaped and off center. this pattern is of a different color than the object itself. after taking my last photo at 4:56am while looking at the camera to ensure i had the object fairly well centered i noticed it was not as bright as it was. i quickly looked up and saw the object getting fainter and fainter and within 3 seconds it was completely gone and not visible. apparently this object was moving away from me at a very high rate of speed. this object resembles one i took on may 28, 2009 at approximately 5:10am and approximately in the same location. [cms\tg\pid]
